intro: Plectronia wildii, commonly known as the wildii plectronia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves, which are often lobed. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
